page.title: 14MAPLEDURHAM HOUSE
page.content: There have been two {houses}on the same spot.The first was built around about {1110.}There is still part of it standing.The second was built in { {1580.}On the side of the second house is a small plaque with a sun on it.It means that the house is insured by the Sun Insurance Company.The timbers from the first house were probably growing in the time of the making of the Domesday Book.{Mr Eyston }owns { {Mapledurham }House,Mapledurham Watermill,Mapledurham Church and mos of the village and five farms.He also owns the riverbed but not the water that flows through it. {Mr Eyston } inherited the land from his cousin but it was his great grandmother's home. From the woodland they used the trees for Spitfires for in World War Two.
